intro: Lamium maculatum var. madrodonton, commonly known as the spotted deadnettle, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive red or purple markings, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a shade-tolerant, decorative plant.
